image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: A woman with short white hair in a navy blue and white stripped button-down shirt stands on a footpath smiling.

props.synopsis: For Deb Stevens Burrangiri aged care respite facility in Canberra's south was a "lifeline" as her mother's dementia progressed, but the ACT's Health Minister says it's unlikely the facility will be the recipient of a promised $10 million federal funding boost should an Albanese government be re-elected.

title.children: Deb wants her 'lifeline' funded but the health minister say it's unlikely

image.altText: A woman in a paint-splattered button down shirt looks upward while painting on a canvas.

props.synopsis: With a canvas strapped to her back atop her bike, artist Sophie Baker cuts an unusual figure in the Canberra bush — now artists like her are ditching the studio to embrace painting in the open air as part of a new festival.

title.children: 'Into the bush': Artists ditch the studio to embrace open air painting

image.altText: Several veterans hold flags and walk in the street.

props.synopsis: Thousands of people have come together to mark Anzac Day across the country, 110 years after Australian and New Zealand soldiers landed on the Turkish coastline at Gallipoli.

title.children: 'I can't see it dwindling': Vietnam vet praises crowds at marches

image.altText: A black and white photo of a soldier throwing a pigeon into the air.

props.synopsis: In the dense jungle of New Guinea, April 1944, a patrol of American troops with vital military intel were surrounded by enemy troops when their radios stopped working.

title.children: 'Rat on wings': The little bird that won a bravery medal

image.altText: Dutton looks serious, part of the frame is filled by the backs of reporters

props.synopsis: ACT politicians Andrew Leigh and David Pocock slam Peter Dutton's commitment today to cut 41,000 Canberra-based public service jobs.

title.children: 'Mathematical innumeracy': Dutton's commitment to cut Canberra public service slammed

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: The scene of the car crash on Canberra Avenue near Burke Crescent in Griffith.

props.synopsis: Charges against a man accused of hitting two St Edmund's College students with an allegedly stolen car as they crossed the road to school last month are to be upgraded to culpable driving causing grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Man accused of hitting Canberra schoolboys with car has charges upgraded

image.altText: A gas flare with a line graph indicating gas prices

props.synopsis: Gas has been making lots of headlines throughout this election campaign. As we enter the final week, there are a few things to know about gas, how much of it we use, and what role it plays in our power bills.

title.children: The six things you should know about gas and if it can make power cheaper

image.altText: a man wearing army uniform speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's anti-corruption watchdog has been repeatedly photographed in full military regalia since taking on the $780,000 a year role.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog boss's defence links spark impartiality concerns

image.altText: Albanese democracy sausage Tasmania

props.synopsis: The $200 million election commitment rebrands and expands an existing health hotline.

title.children: 'Life isn't 9 to 5': Labor promises free, after-hours GP hotline

image.altText: A composite image of three women and a man

props.synopsis: The ABC revisited American voters from across the political spectrum about their thoughts and feelings almost 100 days into Trump's second term.

title.children: We checked in on American voters almost 100 days into Trump 2.0

image.altText: A white blonde woman sits next to an older man in a court room

props.synopsis: After a high-profile mistrial, the controversial case of Karen Read is back in court as her legal team continues to say she's being framed.

title.children: A US woman is accused of killing her boyfriend — but is it a cover-up?

image.altText: A woman in bushland looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: Vaccine Nation is a warning about the acceleration of the anti-vaccination movement during the pandemic and worrying declines in vaccination rates around the world. Can we correct course before it's too late?

title.children: How COVID antivaxxers fuelled a worrying backlash to a life-saving science

image.altText: elon musk shrugs while standing in front of a seated donald trump in the oval office

props.synopsis: Experts say it could be too late for Tesla to "separate the man from the machine" as Elon Musk's personal brand hits an all-time low.

title.children: Musk has refocused on Tesla but experts say the 'rot has set in' already

image.altText: crowds of people protest in tel aviv holding signs of the hostages faces who were taken by Hamas

props.synopsis: The families demand Benjamin Netanyahu end the war, saying if he refuses, they will "take action to topple him in order to save the hostages".

title.children: Families threaten to topple Netanyahu to 'save' Israeli hostages

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Looking for a chance to embarrass yourself? Today's your lucky day.

title.children: Like a quiz with a serving of sass? Come on in. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: A series of ads for both liberal and labor party members, each represented respectively either by the colour blue or red.

props.synopsis: The federal election campaign battle on Chinese social media platforms has intensified, with a surge in candidates seeking to win over Chinese-Australian voters.

title.children: An intensifying election battle is unfolding on Chinese social media apps

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather handing out how-to-vote cards.

props.synopsis: After the Greens took over three new seats in Queensland's south-east in 2022, political analysts predicted the party was headed for a "surge" in popularity. But according to the polls, their primary vote is only marginally up from where it was three years ago.

title.children: Queensland's Greens seats 'now in play' after popularity surge in 2022

image.altText: Virginia Roberts Giuffre

props.synopsis: She exposed the elite and broke her silence — now she's gone, but her story refuses to die.

title.children: Staring down the elite, Virginia Giuffre refused to be silenced

image.altText: Woman wearing red plaid shirt standing in covered patio.

props.synopsis: Can one partner meet all of our emotional and sexual needs? Meet the polyamorous Australians questioning relationship norms, and redefining what love and loyalty looks like.

title.children: What is 'ethical non-monogamy' and why are more Australians considering it?

image.altText: Smoke from an explosion is seen at a port in Iran

props.synopsis: The blast happened at the Shahid Rajaei port just outside a major facility for container shipments for the Islamic Republic that handles some 80 million tons of goods annually.

title.children: Chemicals blamed for fatal port blast in Southern Iran that injured hundreds

image.altText: Large billboard of man with politcal slogans

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli has hit out at "young thugs" he says are taunting the government on social media.

title.children: Queensland premier says 'bring it on' to 'young thugs' in taunting videos

image.altText: Giants AFL players look dejected after walking from the field.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs steamroll GWS by 32 points to notch their first back-to-back wins of the season, while Port Adelaide and the Brisbane Lions also taste victory.

title.children: Dejected Giants 'got some things to work out' after falling to Bulldogs

image.altText: Nathan Cleary look towards the big screen during an NRL match

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers, winners of the past four NRL competitions, will end the round eight bottom of the ladder after losing to Manly at Western Sydney Stadium.

title.children: 'Disappointing' Panthers fall to bottom of the NRL with another loss

image.altText: Round The Twist cast in front of the lighthouse.

props.synopsis: The surreal children's TV show managed to capture two generations of kids. This year it celebrates its 35th birthday.

title.children: Commercial television almost killed Round the Twist

image.altText: Image of thick vines with grapes on them.

props.synopsis: Once almost lost, these fragile old vines are now the focus of DNA testing and efforts to preserve Australia's oldest vineyards.

title.children: Australia's wine roots run a lot deeper than you think

image.altText: Auckland FC players celebrate a goal in the A-League Men competition.

props.synopsis: A-League Men newcomer Auckland FC secures the Premiers Plate after Melbourne City was held to a 0—0 draw by Adelaide United.

title.children: Auckland FC wins A-League Men premiership in first season

image.altText: Southside Flyers basketballer Bec Cole has one hand on her ear and the other raised with an open mouth, joyful in celebration.

props.synopsis: WNBL players celebrate the league's ground-breaking new collective bargaining agreement (CBA), which gives players on minimum wage a big pay bump.

title.children: 'Single biggest investment' in WNBL sees big minimum wage increase

image.altText: Police arresting a man near a tram

props.synopsis: Clashes between protesters and police in Melbourne lead to two arrests, with chaos spilling out onto CBD streets.

title.children: Two arrested following fiery protests in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: A cute dog

props.synopsis: The beloved miniature dachshund, who disappeared on a South Australian island 529 days ago, has been found safe and well by wildlife rescuers.

title.children: Missing sausage dog 'finally safe' after 17 months on island

image.altText: Kristy Alleson

props.synopsis: In the upcoming federal election, there are five seats in regional Australia that could influence the overall result. Here's why they matter.

title.children: Five seats that could change the course of the election

image.altText: Peter Dutton Laura Tingle

props.synopsis: We have a sometimes mystifying relationship with ideas about honouring those who serve our country, and with ideas about how we defend it.

title.children: Australia needs to answer urgent questions about its defence budget

image.altText: CECOT inmates

props.synopsis: At CECOT in El Salvador there are no family visits, no access to the outdoors, no rehabilitation programs.

title.children: Inside El-Salvador's mega-prison for gangs and Trump deportees

image.altText: A man looking at a cassowary walking by.

props.synopsis: A devastating cyclone helped Kenn Parker build his rainforest home, and now his favourite neighbours are the cassowaries who come to visit with their chicks.

title.children: The house that Yasi built: One man's solitary life with the cassowaries
